alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 5:05AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Significant Snow And Possible Blizzard Conditions Over Northwest Alaska Tuesday PM through Wednesday PM... A weather front moving east across Northwest Alaska late Tuesday into Wednesday is expected to bring heavy snow over Northwest Alaska Tuesday PM into Wednesday PM with a chance of blizzard conditions along the Coast from the Bering Strait to Point Hope. The heaviest snow and strongest winds are expected near Point Hope Tuesday night. Areas south of Kotzebue can expect 2-6 inches of snow, while heavier amounts up to 14 inches are expected from Kotzebue north. Temperatures will warm up dramatically with the weather front on Tuesday night.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast
